categories.name: Model Settings
categories.description: AI model configuration and driving behavior tuning.

settings.label: Adjust Camera Offset
settings.description: Virtually shift camera's perspective to move model's center to Left (+ values) or Right (- values).
settings.useCase: Correct for camera mounting position or driver preference for lane position.
tradeoffs: Positive values shift car towards left side of lane.
Negative values shift car towards right side of lane.
Too much offset can cause lane departure warnings.
settings.userNote: Default 0.00. Adjust if you feel the car drives too far left or right in the lane.

settings.label: Live Learning Steer Delay
settings.description: Allow device to learn and adapt car's steering response time.
settings.useCase: Automatically compensates for vehicle-specific steering latency.
settings.deepDive: Measures the delay between commanded steering angle and actual wheel movement, then adjusts predictions to compensate.
settings.userNote: Keep ON for optimal steering response.

settings.label: Lane Turn Desire
settings.description: Forces the model to execute a turn when the blinker is active. Primarily used for 90-degree turns at intersections.
settings.useCase: Helps the car commit to sharp turns at lower speeds.
tradeoffs: Not primarily for lane changes.
May be too aggressive in tight traffic.
settings.userNote: Enable if lane changes feel sluggish or delayed.

settings.label: Driving Model
settings.description: Select the AI driving model. Each model has unique driving characteristics.
settings.useCase: Choose a model that matches your driving style and road conditions.
settings.userNote: See the Model Library for detailed descriptions of all 66+ available models.

settings.label: üìö Model Library
settings.description: Browse the complete library of 66+ driving models with descriptions, release dates, and community consensus.
settings.useCase: Find the perfect model for your driving style.
settings.userNote: Includes WMI Series, Dark Souls, Down to Ride, Tomb Raider, and Legacy models.

categories.name: Device Settings
categories.description: Hardware management, cellular, and power settings.

settings.label: GSM Metered
settings.description: Enables cellular data metering to track and limit data usage.
settings.useCase: Monitor data consumption when using mobile hotspot or cellular connection.
settings.userNote: Keep ON to track data usage on metered connections.

settings.label: GSM Roaming
settings.description: Allow cellular roaming when outside your carrier's network.
settings.useCase: Enable when traveling internationally and need connectivity.
tradeoffs: Can incur significant roaming charges.
May have slower connection speeds.
settings.warning: May incur roaming charges. Keep OFF unless traveling.

settings.label: GSM APN
settings.description: Access Point Name for cellular data connection.
settings.useCase: Configure custom APN settings for your cellular carrier.
settings.userNote: Only modify if your carrier requires specific APN settings.

settings.label: Create Backup
settings.description: Backup current settings to device storage.
settings.useCase: Save your current configuration before updates or changes.
settings.userNote: Recommended before major updates or reinstalls.

settings.label: Restore Version
settings.description: Restore settings from a previous backup.
settings.useCase: Recover your configuration after a reset or new installation.

settings.label: Uninstall sunnypilot
settings.description: Completely remove sunnypilot from the device.
settings.useCase: Clean uninstall before switching to a different fork.
settings.warning: This will remove all sunnypilot data and settings.

settings.label: Max Time Offroad
settings.description: Maximum idle time (in seconds) before the device shuts down when offroad.
settings.useCase: Control how long the device stays on after parking.
tradeoffs: Higher values keep device ready longer but drain battery.
Lower values save battery but may not complete uploads.
settings.userNote: Default 1800 seconds (30 minutes). Increase if uploads aren't completing.

settings.label: Force Power Down
settings.description: Force immediate shutdown of the device.
settings.useCase: Quickly power off when leaving the vehicle for extended periods.
settings.userNote: Use to immediately shut down instead of waiting for timeout.

settings.label: Reboot
settings.description: Restart the device immediately.
settings.useCase: Apply settings changes or fix software issues.
settings.userNote: Use after making significant configuration changes.

settings.label: Power Off
settings.description: Power off the device immediately.
settings.useCase: Safely shut down before disconnecting power.
settings.userNote: Use instead of unplugging for graceful shutdown.

settings.label: GitHub Username
settings.description: Connected GitHub account for development and updates.
settings.useCase: Link your GitHub account for custom fork management.
settings.userNote: Required for pushing custom changes or accessing private forks.

settings.label: Enable sunnypilot
settings.description: Master toggle for sunnypilot functionality.
settings.useCase: Quickly enable/disable all sunnypilot features.
settings.warning: Disabling turns off all assisted driving features.
settings.userNote: Keep ON for normal operation.

settings.label: Lane Departure Warnings
settings.description: Enable lane departure warning alerts.
settings.useCase: Get audible alerts when drifting out of lane without blinker.
tradeoffs: Can be annoying on roads with poor lane markings.
May conflict with intentional lane changes.
settings.userNote: Useful for long highway drives to maintain alertness.

settings.label: Record Front Lock
settings.description: Prevents the device from deleting front camera footage.
settings.useCase: Preserve specific drive recordings for evidence or review.
settings.userNote: Useful if you need to save a specific drive for evidence.

settings.label: Device ID
settings.description: Unique device identifier.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Used for device identification and support.

settings.label: Git Commit
settings.description: Current software version hash.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Useful for bug reports.

settings.label: openpilot Version
settings.description: Software version number.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows current installed version.

settings.label: Git Branch
settings.description: Current git branch name.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows which branch you're running (e.g., 'dev', 'release').

settings.label: Uptime Offroad
settings.description: System idle time in seconds.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows how long device has been on while parked.

settings.label: Serial Number
settings.description: Hardware serial number.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Used for device identification.

settings.label: Route Count
settings.description: Total number of recorded routes.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows how many drives have been recorded.

settings.label: Git Commit Date
settings.description: Date of current commit.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows when current version was built.

settings.label: Uptime Onroad
settings.description: Session driving time in seconds.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows total driving time for current session.

settings.label: Force Offroad Mode
settings.description: Disables active driving features to unlock settings restricted while driving.
settings.useCase: Use when parked to change settings (Offroad), or for Valet mode.
settings.userNote: 'Offroad' means parked/not driving. 'Onroad' means driving.

settings.label: Enable sunnylink Uploader
settings.description: Uploads drive data to Sunnylink servers (currently infrastructure test only).
settings.useCase: Infrastructure testing. Uploaded data is currently not viewable by users.
tradeoffs: Uses mobile data if WiFi not available.
Privacy considerations - drive data is uploaded.
Visualizer not yet functional.
settings.userNote: Currently for testing only. You cannot view your drives yet.

settings.label: Show Advanced Controls
settings.description: Unlocks hidden settings menus.
settings.useCase: Access all available configuration options.
settings.userNote: Keep ON to see everything in this list.

settings.label: Quick Boot
settings.description: Attempts to boot the software faster by skipping checks.
settings.useCase: Faster startup for impatient users.
tradeoffs: May miss important initialization steps.
Can cause instability or crashes.
settings.warning: Can cause instability. Keep OFF unless boot times are annoying.

settings.label: Disengage On Accelerator
settings.description: Cancels openpilot when you touch the gas pedal.
settings.useCase: Keep OFF if you want to help accelerate without disengaging.
tradeoffs: OFF: Can assist with acceleration but steering stays active.
ON: Any gas pedal input fully disengages the system.
settings.userNote: Keep OFF if you want to be able to help the car accelerate without canceling steering.

settings.label: Always-on Driver Monitor
settings.description: Keeps the driver facing camera active even when not engaged.
settings.useCase: Continuous attention tracking for added safety.
tradeoffs: Always watching - privacy consideration.
Higher power consumption.
settings.userNote: Tracks your attention 24/7.

settings.label: Disable Power Down
settings.description: Keeps the device on forever.
settings.useCase: Testing or development where you need constant uptime.
tradeoffs: Will drain car battery if left unplugged.
Device runs hot continuously.

settings.label: Disable Updates
settings.description: Stops automatic software updates.
settings.useCase: Lock in a known-good version.
tradeoffs: Misses bug fixes and new features.
May become incompatible with Sunnylink services over time.
settings.userNote: Use if you find a version you love and don't want it to change.

categories.name: Steering Settings
categories.description: Configuration for lateral control and lane keeping.

settings.label: MADS Enabled
settings.description: Modular Automated Driving System. Decouples steering from gas/brake, allowing steering to remain active during manual pedal input.
settings.useCase: Essential for highway driving where you want to manually coast or brake for traffic without losing lane keeping.
tradeoffs: Requires changing your mental model (Braking does NOT disengage steering).
Can feel like the car is 'fighting' you if you change lanes without a blinker.
settings.deepDive: Separates the Lateral Control state machine from the Longitudinal Cruise state. MADS remains in 'Active' state even when 'Cruise' state goes to 'Disabled'.
settings.userNote: Critical. This is the core feature of Sunnypilot. Keep ON.

settings.label: MADS Steering Mode
settings.description: Controls behavior when cruise is canceled. 'Remain Active' keeps steering engaged after braking.
settings.useCase: When you want to maintain lane centering during manual speed adjustments in traffic.
tradeoffs: May surprise new users who expect steering to stop when braking.
Requires more attention to override steering when intentionally changing lanes.
settings.userNote: Set to 'Remain Active' to keep lane centering while manually braking.

settings.label: MADS Main Cruise Allowed
settings.description: Allows MADS to be active simultaneously with the main cruise control system.
settings.userNote: Keep ON.

settings.label: MADS Unified Engagement Mode
settings.description: If enabled, engaging the main cruise control will also automatically engage MADS steering.
settings.useCase: Simplifies activation - one button press enables both speed control and steering.
settings.userNote: Convenient for one-button activation.

settings.label: Neural Network Lateral Control
settings.description: Replaces PID controller with a neural network for smoother, human-like steering.
settings.useCase: Fixes 'ping-pong' (oscillation) on straight roads common in Hyundai/Kia vehicles.
tradeoffs: Can feel 'loose' or unresponsive if the model is not well-tuned for your specific car.
Does not increase physical torque limits; cannot take turns sharper than the hardware allows.
May cause ping-ponging on some vehicles - leave OFF if this occurs.
settings.deepDive: Uses an end-to-end lateral planning policy (e.g., North Nevada model) to predict path curvature rather than reacting to current lane deviation.
settings.userNote: Test carefully. If it ping-pongs, disable it and stick to stock.

settings.label: Dynamic Experimental Control
settings.description: Automatically switches between Chill Mode (Highway) and Experimental Mode (City) based on driving context.
settings.useCase: Perfect for mixed commutes involving both freeways and city streets with traffic lights.
tradeoffs: Can cause phantom braking if it falsely detects a red light or stop sign.
May switch modes unpredictably in complex intersections.
Can cause late braking for lights/signs.
Makes evaluating specific models harder due to mode switching.
settings.deepDive: Monitors the 'slow_down_prob' from the model. If probability > threshold, injects Experimental Mode longitudinal plan.
settings.userNote: Good for mixed driving, but switch to full Experimental if you need consistent behavior.

settings.label: Driving Personality
settings.description: Adjusts following distance and acceleration aggression.
settings.useCase: Customize driving feel - Relaxed for safety, Aggressive for keeping up with traffic.
tradeoffs: Aggressive mode may feel unsafe in stop-and-go traffic.
Relaxed mode may frustrate drivers behind you with large gaps.
settings.userNote: 'Standard' is the default. 'Aggressive' follows closer; 'Relaxed' leaves more gaps.

settings.label: Enforce Torque Control
settings.description: Forces the car to use a torque-based controller for steering.
settings.useCase: For vehicles that respond better to direct torque commands vs angle commands.
settings.userNote: Usually kept OFF if using NNLC.

settings.label: Self-Tune
settings.description: Allows the car to self-calibrate steering parameters over time.
settings.useCase: Improves steering feel as the system learns your car's specific characteristics.
tradeoffs: Takes time to learn - steering may feel off initially.
Values can drift if driving conditions are unusual.
settings.userNote: Keep ON for better performance as you drive more.

settings.label: Less Restrict Settings for Self-Tune
settings.description: Beta feature that allows the self-tuner to be more aggressive/forgiving when learning.
tradeoffs: Faster learning but potentially unstable values.
May need manual reset if values drift too far.
settings.warning: Use with caution; allows faster learning but potentially wilder values.

settings.label: Enable Custom Torque Tuning
settings.description: Unlocks manual sliders for torque friction and lat-accel factors.
settings.useCase: For advanced users who want precise control over steering feel.
tradeoffs: Requires deep understanding of vehicle dynamics.
Wrong values can make steering dangerous.
settings.warning: Advanced Only. Don't touch unless you know your car's specific physics.

settings.label: Blinker Min Lateral Control Speed
settings.description: The minimum speed at which the car will continue steering while the blinker is on.
settings.useCase: Prevents steering fight during slow turns at intersections.
settings.userNote: Prevents the wheel from fighting you during slow turns at intersections.

settings.label: Blinker Pause Lateral Control
settings.description: Pauses steering assistance immediately when the blinker is activated.
settings.useCase: For drivers who want complete manual control during lane changes.
tradeoffs: Steering immediately releases - can feel sudden.
No lane keeping during intentional lane changes.
settings.userNote: Preferred by drivers who want full control during lane changes.

settings.label: Hyundai Longitudinal Tuning
settings.description: Custom tuning for Hyundai/Kia acceleration profiles.
settings.useCase: Fixes the sluggish throttle response in Eco/Normal drive modes.
tradeoffs: Dynamic can feel too aggressive for some users.
May affect fuel efficiency.
settings.userNote: 'Dynamic' can fix sluggish acceleration in Eco/Normal modes.

settings.label: Longitudinal Maneuver Mode
settings.description: Specialized handling for low-speed maneuvers.
settings.useCase: Smoother stop-and-go traffic behavior.
settings.userNote: Helps with stop-and-go smoothness.

categories.name: Cruise & Speed
categories.description: Configuration for speed management and longitudinal control.

settings.label: Experimental Mode
settings.description: Enables stopping for traffic lights and stop signs using vision only.
settings.useCase: City driving where you encounter frequent traffic lights and stop signs.
tradeoffs: Can brake suddenly for false positives (shadows, markings).
May not stop in time for all lights/signs - be ready to brake.
Smoother braking behind cars, but can be unpredictable.
settings.warning: Be cautious at lights/signs. Requires Alpha Longitudinal.
settings.userNote: Must enable Alpha Longitudinal first.

settings.label: Alpha Longitudinal
settings.description: Uses Openpilot's end-to-end model for gas/brake control instead of stock ACC.
settings.useCase: Smoother following distance management than stock adaptive cruise.
tradeoffs: Can be jerky in stop-and-go on some vehicles.
May brake harder or softer than expected.
settings.userNote: Required for Experimental Mode. Usually smoother than stock.

settings.label: Vision-Based Turn Speed Control
settings.description: Slows the car automatically for sharp curves based on camera vision.
settings.useCase: Driving on winding back roads where maintaining a constant 55mph would be dangerous.
tradeoffs: Often slows down too aggressively (e.g., 20mph below safe speed).
Can annoy drivers behind you due to frequent slowing.
Late braking compared to seeing warning signs.
settings.deepDive: Calculates projected lateral acceleration based on model path. Reduces speed to keep lateral G-forces under ~0.3g.
settings.userNote: Very helpful on winding back roads.

settings.label: Smart Cruise Control - Map
settings.description: Uses map data to slow down for curves.
settings.useCase: Backup for vision-based control when camera visibility is poor.
tradeoffs: Relies on map accuracy - may not reflect actual road conditions.
Can slow prematurely for curves that have been straightened.
settings.userNote: Good backup, but Vision is usually faster/reactive.

settings.label: Speed Limit Assist Mode
settings.description: Determines if the car automatically adjusts speed to posted limits.
settings.useCase: Long road trips through towns with varying speed traps.
tradeoffs: Extremely reliant on map data accuracy.
Can cause dangerous rapid braking if it reads an off-ramp speed limit while on the highway.
May trigger on conditional signs (school zones) when not active.
settings.deepDive: Aggregates data from OpenStreetMap (OSM), car camera (TSR), and navigation data to determine the current limit.
settings.userNote: 'Information' just shows the sign. 'Auto' changes your speed for you.

settings.label: Speed Limit Source
settings.description: Where the car gets speed data (Map Data, Car State, or Combined).
settings.useCase: Choose the most reliable source for your driving area.
tradeoffs: Map Data: Most consistent but can be outdated.
Car State: Real-time but only works where camera can read signs.
Combined: Best coverage but potential conflicts.
settings.userNote: 'Map Data Priority' is usually most accurate in the US.

settings.label: Speed Limit Offset Type
settings.description: Choose between a fixed number (e.g., +5 mph) or a percentage (e.g., +10%).
settings.useCase: Fixed for consistent speeding; Percentage for proportional adjustments.
settings.userNote: Set to 'Fixed' for consistent speeding.

settings.label: Speed Limit Offset Value
settings.description: The actual amount to speed over the limit.
settings.useCase: Match local traffic flow (commonly 5-10 mph over in most US areas).
settings.userNote: Set to your comfort level (e.g., 5-10 mph over).

settings.label: Auto Lane Change Timer
settings.description: Sets the delay/confirmation method for automatic lane changes.
settings.useCase: Choose comfort level with automated lane changes.
tradeoffs: Instant: Fast but less safe - no confirmation.
Nudge: Requires slight wheel input - good balance.
Timer: Adds delay - safest but slowest.
settings.userNote: 'Nudge' requires wheel input; 'Instant' is automatic.

settings.label: Auto Lane Change BSM Delay
settings.description: Adds a safety delay if the Blind Spot Monitor (BSM) detects a car.
settings.useCase: Prevents lane change attempts when a vehicle is in your blind spot.
settings.userNote: Safety: Keep ON.

settings.label: Map Advisory Speed Limit
settings.description: Respects yellow 'advisory' speed signs on curves/ramps.
settings.useCase: Automatically slow for highway off-ramp advisory speeds.
settings.userNote: Keep ON for safety on off-ramps.

settings.label: Custom ACC Increments
settings.description: Changes how much the speed changes when you press +/- on the wheel.
settings.useCase: Fine-tune speed adjustments - small taps for precision.
settings.userNote: Customize short press to ¬±1 and long press to ¬±5.

categories.name: Visuals & UI
categories.description: Customizes the screen layout and information displayed.

settings.label: Rainbow Mode
settings.description: Easter egg: Makes the lane lines flash colors.
settings.useCase: Fun visual effect for showing off the system.
tradeoffs: Distracting while driving.
May cause eye strain.
settings.userNote: Fun, but distracting.

settings.label: Display Road Name
settings.description: Shows the current street name on the UI.
settings.useCase: Situational awareness when navigating unfamiliar areas.
settings.userNote: Nice for situational awareness.

settings.label: Green Light Alert
settings.description: Chimes when a red light turns green.
settings.useCase: Alert distracted drivers to proceed when light changes.
settings.deepDive: Uses the traffic light recognition model to detect state changes from red/yellow to green.
settings.userNote: Very useful feature for distracted drivers.

settings.label: Lead Depart Alert
settings.description: Chimes when the car in front starts moving.
settings.useCase: Prevents getting honked at in stop-and-go traffic.
settings.userNote: Good for stop-and-go traffic.

settings.label: Show Turn Signals
settings.description: Visualizes your blinkers on the device screen.
settings.useCase: Visual confirmation that blinker is active.
settings.userNote: Mostly cosmetic verification.

settings.label: Display Rocket Fuel Bar
settings.description: Visualizes real-time acceleration and deceleration intensity.
settings.useCase: Understand how hard the system is braking or accelerating.
settings.userNote: Cool visual, helps you see how hard the car is braking.

settings.label: Blind Spot Detection
settings.description: Shows an icon when a car is in your blind spot.
settings.useCase: Redundant BSM warning if you miss the mirror indicator.
settings.userNote: Extra safety layer if you don't look at mirrors (please look at mirrors).

settings.label: Screen Brightness
settings.description: Sets the display backlight level.
settings.userNote: 'Auto' usually works best.

settings.label: Onroad Brightness
settings.description: Sets brightness specifically when driving.

categories.name: Developer Settings
categories.description: Advanced tools for debugging and development.

settings.label: Enable SSH
settings.description: Opens a secure shell for remote command-line access.
settings.warning: Security Risk. Keep OFF unless you are coding.
settings.useCase: Developer access for debugging and advanced configuration.
tradeoffs: Security vulnerability if device is on public network.
Can allow unauthorized access if password is weak.

settings.label: Enable ADB
settings.description: Android Debug Bridge. Allows USB debugging.
settings.useCase: Developer access via USB cable.
settings.userNote: Developer use only.

settings.label: copyparty Service
settings.description: Runs a local file server on the device.
settings.useCase: Download drive videos over WiFi without SSH.
settings.userNote: Easy way to download drive videos via WiFi.

settings.label: Manual Software Delay
settings.description: Manually adjusts the delay between command and action.
settings.warning: Don't touch. Leave on '0.00' unless instructed by devs.
settings.useCase: Developer-only: Override learned steering delay.

settings.label: Disable Logging
settings.description: Stops saving drive data to disk.
settings.useCase: Save storage space or for privacy.
tradeoffs: Loses all drive evidence in case of accident.
Cannot review or upload drives.
settings.warning: Saves space, but you lose evidence if an accident happens.

settings.label: Manual Real-Time Tuning
settings.description: Allows you to override torque values while driving.
settings.warning: Debug Only. Dangerous for normal use.

categories.name: Other Settings
categories.description: Miscellaneous settings including AGNOS, plan controls, and car-specific configurations.

settings.label: Last AGNOS Power Monitor Shutdown
settings.description: Timestamp of the last AGNOS power monitor shutdown event.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows when device last shut down due to power monitoring.

settings.label: Plan Plus Controls
settings.description: Adjust planplus model recentering strength. The higher this number, the more aggressively the model will recenter to lanecenter. Too high and it will ping-pong.
settings.useCase: Fine-tune how aggressively the model corrects back to center lane position.
tradeoffs: Higher values = more aggressive centering but potential ping-pong.
Lower values = smoother but may drift from center.
settings.userNote: Default 1.0. Increase if car drifts too much, decrease if ping-ponging.

settings.label: Display Rocket Fuel Bar
settings.description: Show an indicator on the left side of the screen to display real-time vehicle acceleration and deceleration.
settings.useCase: Visualize how hard the system is accelerating or braking.
settings.userNote: Cool visual indicator showing throttle/brake intensity.

settings.label: Has Accepted sunnypilot Terms
settings.description: Indicates whether user has accepted sunnypilot terms of service.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows acceptance status.

settings.label: Supported Car List
settings.description: View all supported platforms in sunnypilot.
settings.useCase: Check if your vehicle is officially supported.
settings.userNote: Opens JSON list of all compatible vehicles.

settings.label: Completed sunnylink Consent Version
settings.description: Version of sunnylink consent form that was completed.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows which consent version you've agreed to.

settings.label: Toyota: Enforce Factory Longitudinal Control
settings.description: When enabled, sunnypilot will not take over control of gas and brakes. Factory Toyota longitudinal control will be used.
settings.useCase: Use Toyota's stock ACC instead of sunnypilot's longitudinal control.
tradeoffs: Factory ACC may be smoother but less intelligent.
Loses sunnypilot's advanced stop-and-go features.
settings.userNote: Enable if you prefer Toyota's stock adaptive cruise behavior.

settings.label: Plan Plus Controls
settings.description: Adjust planplus model recentering strength. The higher this number, the more aggressively the model will recenter to lanecenter. Too high and it will ping-pong.
settings.useCase: Secondary adjustment for Plan Plus lane centering behavior.
settings.userNote: Default 1.0. Fine-tune lane centering aggression.

settings.label: Has Accepted sunnypilot Terms
settings.description: Indicates whether user has accepted sunnypilot terms of service.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Duplicate consent status field.

settings.label: Completed sunnylink Consent Version
settings.description: Version of sunnylink consent form that was completed.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Shows consent version.

settings.label: Last AGNOS Power Monitor Shutdown
settings.description: Timestamp of the last AGNOS power monitor shutdown event.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Alternative power shutdown timestamp.

settings.label: sunnylink Dongle ID
settings.description: Unique sunnylink device identifier for cloud connectivity.
settings.userNote: Read-only. Your device's unique ID for sunnylink services.
